keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, and died as a result of injuries sustained during the assault.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges.
The body-camera footage, though silent, captured guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, showing a lack of concern and contributing significantly to the prosecution’s case.
Prosecutors argued that all guards acted as a gang and showed depraved indifference to human life, with William Fitzpatrick asserting that the actions were collectively criminal.
Brooks had a prior 12-year sentence for first-degree assault and was transferred to the facility that night.
Six of the 10 guards indicted in February faced murder charges; five pleaded guilty to manslaughter, one to a misdemeanor of attempted tampering with evidence.
Kieffer and Galliher were charged with second-degree gang assault and false instrument filing, but were acquitted.
The case was prosecuted by William Fitzpatrick, who took over due to Attorney General Letitia James’s recusal over civil lawsuits involving prison officers.
Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting a similar case involving the death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility on March 1, 2025.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York state prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the fatal beating of inmate Robert Brooks, who was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The incident, captured on silent body-camera footage showing guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, triggered public outrage and led to the prosecution of five guards, with three acquitted including Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer. The prosecution, led by Onondaga County District Attorney William Fitzpatrick, argued that the guards acted collectively as a gang with depraved indifference to human life. Fitzpatrick, who took over due to Attorney General Letitia James's recusal over civil lawsuits, is also prosecuting a similar case involving the death of inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility in March 2025, indicating a broader pattern of abuse and systemic failure within the state’s prison system.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
